title: Why is Donald Trump referring to April 2 as 'Liberation Day'?
shortDescription: Donald Trump is expected to announce sweeping tariffs on what he's been calling "Liberation Day." Here's what we know.

title: Cory Booker's marathon speech on Senate floor: What to know.
shortDescription: U.S. Sen. Cory Booker has kicked off what's set to be a marathon speech on the Senate floor Monday evening. He began at 7 p.m. ET.

title: Centuries-old magnolia tree set to be removed from White House
shortDescription: A tree almost two centuries old and said to be planted by former President Andrew Jackson is set to be removed from the grounds of the White House.

title: Trump travel ban indefinitely postponed
shortDescription: The State Department said it is continuing to work on a report for President Donald Trump on which countries should get new visa restrictions.

title: New Mexico GOP calling fire at Albuquerque headquarters arson
shortDescription: The Republican Party of New Mexico are declaring a fire that burned an entryway at their Albuquerque headquarters an act of political arson.

title: 'Respect was shattered': GOP Rep. Luna leaves House Freedom Caucus
shortDescription: Anna Paulina Luna wrote in a letter that she was leaving the House Freedom Caucus over their stance on her efforts to let new parents vote by proxy.

title: Judge blocks Trump firing of DEI office intel staffers
shortDescription: Judges in several cases have blocked the firing of staffers in diversity, equity and inclusion offices under President Trump's executive order.

title: Trump administration reviews Harvard grants over alleged antisemitism
shortDescription: The focus on Harvard comes after the Trump administration this month canceled $400 million in federal funding for Columbia University.

title: Trump signs executive order targeting ticket scalping
shortDescription: Trump on Monday signed an executive order aimed at overhauling ticket sales for live entertainment ticketing industry.

title: Trump says 'a lot of people would like' him to run for a third term
shortDescription: Trump says he's serious about pursuing a third term because of his polls, though that's not allowed under the Constitution.

title: Trump administration drops lawsuit over Ga. election laws
shortDescription: Justice Department drops Biden-era lawsuit against Georgia laws that advocates say restrict voting, particularly among people of color.

title: Trump withdraws Stefanik's nomination as UN ambassador | The Excerpt
shortDescription: Plus: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. says he will cut about 10,000 full-time jobs. | Why is Trump obsessed with Greenland?

title: Advocates sue over Trump's 'show me your papers' order
shortDescription: The lawsuit claims Trump's executive order would require non-citizens to carry registration ID or face criminal prosecution.

title: Trump administration moves to fire remaining USAID staff | The Excerpt
shortDescription: Plus: At least 1,000 people have been killed after an earthquake in Myanmar. | Some U.S. travelers are fearing border crossings as scrutiny rises.

title: SCOTUS looks at tax exemptions for churches
shortDescription: The Supreme Court heard arguments on whether religiously affiliated groups should pay unemployment taxes.

title: Trump sued over 'national security' order trashing union contracts
shortDescription: A union representing 150,000 U.S. government employees filed suit to block President Trump from ending collective bargaining.

title: Trump optimistic about TikTok as deadline nears
shortDescription: "We have a lot of potential buyers." President Donald Trump expressed optimism about TikTok's survival in the U.S. ahead of a potential ban.

title: Trump deports 17 alleged members of Tren de Aragua, MS-13
shortDescription: The deportations came as the ACLU is fighting the removal of alleged members of Tren de Aragua under the Alien Enemies Act.

title: Trump wants to serve third term. He would be the 2nd in U.S. history
shortDescription: Donald Trump's third term comments have been quickly countered by the 22nd Amendment. One other president in U.S. history has exceeded 2 terms, FDR.

title: Trump says 'there will be bombing' if Iran does not make nuclear deal
shortDescription: Plus: The national implications of a court election in Wisconsin. | Some have been rescued following a 7.7-magnitude earthquake in Myanmar.

title: Trump says he is 'very angry' with Putin over ceasefire plans
shortDescription: President Donald Trump has expressed his frustration toward Russian Leader Vladimir Putin, telling NBC News that he is “very angry” with him over Ukrainian ceasefire negotiations.

title: Kremlin promises peace deal after Trump says 'pissed off' with Putin
shortDescription: The Kremlin said Russia and the U.S. were at work on a peace deal Ukraine after President Donald Trump said he was "pissed off" with Vladimir Putin.
